byline.contributor: Androniki Kitsantonis contributed reporting from Athens.
byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and LIZ ALDERMAN

abstract: Meeting with Greece over its debt results in ultimatum by European creditors to proceed with bailout program or risk losing critical funding needed to avoid default; demand seems to entail part of plan to persuade Greek Prime Min Alexis Tspiras and Finance Min Yanis Varoufakis to back off from anti-austerity stance.
lead_paragraph: Greece dismissed its creditors’ proposals as “unreasonable and unacceptable,” a signal that resolution of its debt crisis is not near.

headline.main: Meeting on Greek Debt Produces an Ultimatum
headline.print_headline: Meeting on Greek Debt Produces an Ultimatum

snippet: Greece dismissed its creditors’ proposals as “unreasonable and unacceptable,” a signal that resolution of its debt crisis is not near.
